resources.string: "This app can be used to find the real and complex solutions of quadratic equations."

"A quadratic equation is an equation of the form \"ax² + bx + c = 0\", where a, b and c are real numbers (like 1, 2.5 or -4.6)." "You can enter a, b and c (also called coefficients) on the main page when you open the app."

"A solution is a real or complex number x, such that both sides of the equation are equal to 0." "Let's consider the example \"x² - 9 = 0\"." "It's quite easy to see that both 3 and -3 solve the equation, because 3² - 9 and (-3)² - 9 are both equal to zero." "If we consider another example like \"4x² + 3x - 9\", the equation isn't as easy to solve anymore." "But with this app, just enter \"4\" in the field labeled \"a\", \"3\" in the field \"b\" and \"-9\" in the field \"c\" and tap on \"Calculate roots\", and the solutions will show up on the top of the screen below the equation."

"Because some equations like \"x² + 1 = 0\" don't have any solutions in the real numbers, we invent the so-called imaginary unit \"i\" which has the property i² = -1." "Thus, we have created two solutions for this equations (i and -i) which are useful in many scenarios."

"This app was a one-man-project by Simon Bohnen." "If you found any wrong translations (which is quite likely), you can contact me using the button below." "I would be especially thankful if you could translate this help page into another language, as I'm (of course) not able to translate this app into all languages."
